humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions 'METASTATIC CARCINOMA INVOLVES SIX or THIRTY-FIVE (6/35) AXILLARY LYMPH NODES.' This indicates that metastases were found in 6 out of 35 assessed axillary lymph nodes. According to the new rule 12, N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that metastatic carcinoma involves six out of thirty-five (6/35) axillary lymph nodes. This corresponds to a pathologic N stage of N2, as defined by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system for breast cancer. The AJCC system classifies N stage based on the number of axillary lymph nodes involved, with N0 indicating no lymph node involvement, N1 indicating 1-3 positive nodes, N2 indicating 4-9 positive nodes, and N3 indicating 10 or more positive nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N2.
